title: Cedar Breaks National Monument: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Be A Junior Ranger         Young girl with over 300 Junior Ranger Badges NPS Photo  There are three ways to become a National Park Junior Ranger! 1. During your visit, stop by the Visitor Center and pick up a free Junior Ranger booklet. Complete the activities and when you're finished find a Park Ranger to receive your badge! 2. Download one of our Junior Ranger Booklets using the links below.  11 x 17 inch Junior Ranger Book - PDF 8.5 x 11 inch Junior Ranger Book - PDF Once downloaded, print it out & complete the activities and send to: Cedar Breaks National Monument 2390 West Highway 56, Suite 11 Cedar City, Utah 84720 Make sure to include your name and mailing address and we will send you back the signed certificate, booklet, and your badge! 3. Become a Become a Web Ranger where you can customize you Ranger Station, earn rewards, and play activities! There are new activities all the time! The Junior Ranger Program at Cedar Breaks National Monument is funded by the Zion Natural History Association.
